clinical_study.brief_title: Representations and Prevention of Cancers in Schools
clinical_study.official_title: Representations and Prevention of Cancers in Schools

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut de Cancérologie de la Loire

clinical_study.source: Institut de Cancérologie de la Loire

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective is to develop an educational program and to measure the impact on social representations identified as acting in the prevention of cancer. Child should write, draw and speak about cancer signifiance to identify individual conceptions and representations of health and cancer in children aged 9 to 12 years in school.

detailed_description.textblock:
The stages are :
- Selection of forms
- Technique of write and draw and interview by a school nurse
- Data analysis

primary_outcome.measure: Number of cancer and health representations in children
primary_outcome.description: Identification of individual cancer and health conceptions and representations in children aged 9 to 12 years in schools

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of association of cancer and health representations with the ecological deprivation index
secondary_outcome.description: Assess whether the prevalence of cancer and health representations is associated with socioeconomic level school zones

arm_group.description: Students aged 9 to 12 years and enrolled in classes CM1, CM2 and 6th

intervention.description: Child should write, draw cancer signifiance and after, they were interview by a school nurse about cancer signifiance.

study_pop.textblock: students aged 9 to 12 years and enrolled in classes CM1, CM2 and 6th

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged between 9 and 12
Exclusion Criteria:
- Boy or Girl ages over 12 years and under 9 years
- Children refusal
